main event: One cigar-shaped object, approximately 50 feet in length, silver and green in color, was observed traveling south in Klamath, Oregon on March 14, 1955.
interesting points: The observer used 8x50 binoculars to watch the object for about 5 minutes., The object changed colors from silver and green to red and sometimes blue., Three separate and contradicting reports were received regarding the sighting., The cause of the sighting remains unknown with no correlation to radar or weather., A low-flying civilian aircraft was reported in the vicinity at an altitude of 5,000 feet during the incident.
witness description: civilian observing the sky through binoculars
